title: (x) suggestions for futuristic digital font - various {gang}
content:
Looking for a futuristic font, but not too futuristic, digital, but not too digital. Think Emigre's Base 9/12 and Cholla. Any suggestions? Thanks!

 [‹ (x) Ben&Jerry's font - Severance (proprietary) {Franz, Stephen}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080310230923/http:/www.typophile.com/node/4105 "Go to previous forum topic") [Bodoni uses ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080310230923/http:/www.typophile.com/node/4101 "Go to next forum topic")
author: glutton

comments.content:
Interesting request. 'Futuristic' and 'digital' seem to be other names for 'techno', which is not my favorite style, so when you said 'not too' in front of those I was intrigued. I would recommend looking in two places: [Psy/Ops](http://web.archive.org/web/20080310230923/http:/www.psyops.com/html/specimens.html), which has Reform, Reykjavik One & Two, Transfer Sans & Default Gothic. The other is [Device Fonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20080310230923/http:/www.veer.com/products/type/det/rs.asp) (Rian Hughes), with September, Gravel, Quagmire, Range & Register.   
   
Of course there are many other foundries with techno styles, but these two foundries come to mind as having some of the less stereotypical 'futuristic' looks, in my opinion. T-26, which also carries Device fonts, has one of the most varied Techno collections.
Maybe Eric Olson would license the typeface he produced for Design Camp. Part of the brief was a font with "traces of FF Isonorm

Or Downtempo, available from Veer (and first seen in the T'phile Critique forums, I believe).   
   
 [http://www.veer.com/results.asp?image=UMT0000022](http://web.archive.org/web/20080310230923/http:/www.veer.com/results.asp?image=UMT0000022)

Thanks for the great suggestions! Unfortunately, it looks like the clients are grooving on [Crillee](http://web.archive.org/web/20080310230923/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/crillee/)... Space: the Final Frontier. Yuck!

Brilliant selection Mike, since "futuristic digital" is   
not your favourite style. Some kewl faces too Marc!
